eventName: So Long, Adele: Home Away From Home
storyInfo: Because of the volcano's abnormal indicators and Eyjafjalla's insistence, Keller chooses at last to stop running from the past and climbs the volcano for the first time since the Naumanns' death to gather data. The party is forced to come to an end, and the attendees begin to evacuate. Kahn finally finds proof from all those years ago, and questions Keller about the truth behind the Naumanns' death.

attributes.content: Adele... What a wonderful name. Can I just call you Adele?
attributes.name: Magna

attributes.content: Have you heard about the thing everyone does the first time they climb a volcano?
attributes.name: Magna

attributes.content: It's roasting fowlbeast eggs in the lava.
attributes.name: Magna

attributes.content: But having climbed twenty-seven volcanoes, I can promise you that, when it comes to cooking eggs, lava and Originium stoves make no difference whatsoever.
attributes.name: Magna

attributes.content: Yeah, you're bound to burn them regardless.
attributes.name: Katia

attributes.content: Hey! You always eat them right up!
attributes.name: Magna

attributes.text: So this is what a volcano really looks like... It's very from what's in the books.

attributes.content: Don't worry, Adele. Just stay right behind me. Anywhere that you see me stepping is going to be safe.
attributes.name: Katia

attributes.content: If you're nervous, why don't you take my hand?
attributes.name: Magna

attributes.content: Adele, you asked us before why we love volcanoes, right?
attributes.name: Magna

attributes.content: I promise you this. Once you see a volcano erupt with your own eyes, you'll never forget the feeling.
attributes.name: Magna

attributes.content: I like to sit on the slopes and meditate. The land and us are both full of mystery, and even if we spend our lifetimes seeking answers, we may not be able to solve even a tiny fraction of them. Still, I do enjoy the puzzle solving.
attributes.name: Magna

attributes.content: Mankind may have invented nomadic cities, but we still haven't completely figured out how Catastrophes form. We may have invented many tools with Originium, but we also have no way to counter their effects when they backfire.
attributes.name: Katia

attributes.content: Humans need to admit just how insignificant they are when they come face to face with nature's mighty forces. That way, they won't spend so much energy meaninglessly slaughtering each other.
attributes.name: Katia

attributes.content: Adele, don't mind Katia's pessimism. Not everywhere is as simple as Siesta.
attributes.name: Magna

attributes.content: It's natural for him to grumble when, as a scholar, he's all wrapped up in noble bickering, but on these issues, I've always looked at things quite differently from him.
attributes.name: Magna

attributes.content: Naturally, humans are insignificant, but it's exactly because we are so insignificant that we can live on the land.
attributes.name: Magna

attributes.text: Life is insignificant, yet mankind insists on seeking answers in the earth with their insignificant lives. When you look at it that way, when they are inevitably swallowed by up by that same earth, you can only accept their fate as par for the course.
But how am I supposed to face the abyss alone after the two of you are gone?

attributes.content: Professor Keller, here's the last two hours of data we got from Monitoring Station No. 1 before the signal was lost.
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: We've never seen abnormalities like this... We have no choice but to consult you...
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: The surface gas concentration hasn't changed. How did the temperature go up by this much so quickly?
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: If the data were real, then that means the energy accumulated in Mount Siesta suddenly increased tenfold... No, it's not possible, no matter how you slice it.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Ignore it as a point anomaly.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Inform the city government that the volcano has become more active and to have the citizens prepare. That's all we can do.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Professor, this may not be your usual point anomaly.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: My parents mentioned similar situations in their research notes... The temperatures in the volcano's surroundings were abnormally high and didn't match the other data.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: They never found the cause, but this can't just be explained as a coincidence.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Professor, shouldn't we head there to take a look at the situation ourselves?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Monitoring Station No. 1 is about midway up the volcano. It's very dangerous to go up there now.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: This kind of data anomaly could just be an equipment malfunction. There's no need to take the risk and head there for on-site inspections. We can adjust the final observation results based on the other monitoring stations' data later.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Professor Keller, I don't understand...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: You kept saying how important this observation was going to be, that it's an opportunity that many scholars had been waiting for. Tens of thousands of the residents could have their lives upended. Shouldn't we be as careful about this as we possibly can?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: If we run away now... isn't that admitting their sacrifice was for nothing?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: The girl's voice is quiet, and her body is trembling ever so slightly. It seems that she spent quite a bit of her strength just to express her honest opinion.
Keller appears a little dazed.
Right...
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.text: How could a sacrifice like that be meaningful?

attributes.content: It doesn't look like I'm going to convince you...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: If you aren't willing to go, is it okay if I go alone...?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Don't be absurd. We don't know what's going on at the volcano. I can't let you go somewhere so dangerous all by yourself—
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Professor Keller... Would you return my mother's protective suit to me?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Is there anything we can do but eat? If this goes on, my stomach's gonna explode...
attributes.name: Passerby A

attributes.content: Listen to a few more guitar songs?
attributes.name: Passerby B

attributes.content: Hm... I kinda feel there's meant to be something more exciting...
attributes.name: Passerby A

attributes.content: How is this supposed to be as exciting as the Obsidian Festival? The crowds were massive, the streets and shops were endless, and the music never ever stopped. That was so much better!
attributes.name: Passerby B

attributes.content: Say what you will, but this party reminds me of the first Obsidian Festival.
attributes.name: Cold Drinks Shop Owner

attributes.content: The first one? How many years ago was that?
attributes.name: Passerby B

attributes.content: Not a whole lot of people still remember, but the first festival was actually held in the mines. It was run but a bunch of miners.
attributes.name: Cold Drinks Shop Owner

attributes.content: Yeah, there weren't that many people, much less decent musicians. They just strummed their guitars and played a few songs they wrote. That's how it all began...
attributes.name: Cold Drinks Shop Owner

attributes.content: Nobody back then could've imagined it would grow so big and attract so many guests.
attributes.name: Cold Drinks Shop Owner

attributes.content: Is the after party gonna come back, too?
attributes.name: Passerby A

attributes.content: Hahaha, now no one can say for sure!
attributes.name: Cold Drinks Shop Owner

attributes.content: But if you guys are moving to the city center, does that mean these shops are gonna be closed forever?
attributes.name: Passerby B

attributes.content: Probably. We might have to make a living some other way, but nobody lives a life without change.
attributes.name: Male Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: That said, whenever we have free time, we might come here and set up a stall, play a few songs. If anybody comes, we'll give them a few skewers to snack on. If nobody comes, we'll just look at the sea, at what lies beyond.
attributes.name: Male Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: I brought a can of sand from the old beach here, too!
attributes.name: Male Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: If the volcano does end up erupting, the old place is going to be covered in ash, right?
attributes.name: Female Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: All the paths we've taken, the shops we visited, the beaches we walked... Everything will be buried under a pile of volcanic ash.
attributes.name: Female Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: But you'll still remember our party here tonight, won't you?
attributes.name: Male Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: Of course... This, too, is a new memory.
attributes.name: Female Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: The shop owner strums the guitar, and the voices of the crowd romping around can be heard from afar.
Hey, you guys aren't gonna dance?
attributes.name: Cold Drinks Shop Owner

attributes.content: This is the time to dance, kids! If all you do is eat and chat, that's not a party!
attributes.name: Cold Drinks Shop Owner

attributes.content: Here, let me play something!
attributes.name: Male Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: Care to join us, ma'am?
attributes.name: Male Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: Byrd strums her guitar strings, and the gentle melody starts to envelope this city plate. Lying on the grass, the people gaze at the night sky, fireflies, and the stars up above.
Then, with a buzz, a disharmonic electric sound can be heard.
Volcanic activity indicates Mount Siesta will very likely erupt within the next few hours.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: The nomadic city has already departed the area that will be affected by the eruption. There is no need for alarm.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: The tremors brought by eruption could lead to a tsunami. All citizens should evacuate coastal areas immediately. All citizens should evacuate coastal areas immediately.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: It's happening? Today? Now? Really picked a terrible time.
attributes.name: Passerby A

attributes.content: Maybe it's the perfect time.
attributes.name: Passerby B

attributes.content: What do they mean by 'evacuate coastal areas immediately?' Is this place gonna be flooded? What about all this stuff? Are we taking anything with us? Anything we leave is gonna get washed away, right?
attributes.name: Passerby A

attributes.content: Don't take anything, just go!
attributes.name: Passerby B

attributes.content: The shop owner stops playing and looks at his partner. The oil fumes originating from the barbecue have yet to dissipate, and her face is still tinted red from the joy that has yet to fade.
She regretfully puts down her barbecue skewers.
Hmm, it's possible that after we leave, the waves will swallow all our footprints today... including my grill and your guitar.
attributes.name: Female Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: Looks like the volcano and the sea are here to help us say goodbye to all that we had in our past.
attributes.name: Male Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: We should head upwards. It won't get flooded there. We'll have a new life.
attributes.name: Male Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: Over at the city center? I'm always worried that it could be too cramped there. There's not enough room for all your instruments and my grill.
attributes.name: Female Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: But there's enough room for the two of us.
attributes.name: Male Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: The owner looks into his partner's eyes. His eyes are glittering.
Suddenly, she starts laughing.
Right...! That's more than enough!
attributes.name: Female Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: That's right, dear. That's more than enough.
attributes.name: Male Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: Come! Let's get Tom, what with how old and frail he is. We can't just leave him here to cry over his precious ice cream.
attributes.name: Male Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: Hey—Tom—! Time to go! If we don't leave before the waves come, you'll get sucked into the sea with all your ice cream!
attributes.name: Female Instrument Shop Owner

attributes.content: Ow... Oww...
attributes.name: Cold Drinks Shop Owner

attributes.content: Where's the young lady who helped me bring the ice cream? We can't leave her behind...
attributes.name: Cold Drinks Shop Owner

attributes.content: (Found it...)
attributes.name: Kahn

attributes.content: (The two missing pages. There's no doubt that this is Professor Katia's handwriting. There's also the military's wax seal.)
attributes.name: Kahn

attributes.content: (Keller, what exactly are you hiding...?)
attributes.name: Kahn

attributes.content: Dr. Kahn?
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: It's you... Where's Professor Keller?
attributes.name: Kahn

attributes.content: The signal from the volcano's monitoring station cut off two hours ago, and the data we got in the end was really strange.
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: Why didn't she inform anyone?
attributes.name: Kahn

attributes.content: She said the situation was critical, and she had to inspect it herself.
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: Did she go alone?
attributes.name: Kahn

attributes.content: No, the intern from Leithanien went with her, I think.
attributes.name: Worker

attributes.content: We made it to the safety zone, right...?
attributes.name: Anxious Passerby

attributes.content: This place is over a hundred kilometers from the volcano. I'm sure we'll be fine...
attributes.name: Nervous Passerby

attributes.content: I mean, that's what city hall said...
attributes.name: Nervous Passerby

attributes.content: But... don't you feel the ground shaking?
attributes.name: Anxious Passerby

attributes.content: Enis! Have you seen Liv?!
attributes.name: Harley

attributes.content: Is she not home...?
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: She wasn't there when I got back. You mean she didn't go look for you?
attributes.name: Harley

attributes.content: Shit...
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Huh? Everybody's gone... Did everyone go have fun somewhere else?
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: Are you the only one here...? Did you get left behind by your friends, too?
attributes.name: Girl

attributes.content: The transport is parked at the foot of the mountain. The once familiar mountain range now sports a completely different appearance.
The flora on the mountain has withered long ago, and the rugged rockscapes now look taller than ever.
With the sun gradually setting, a dark shadow is draped over the two researchers' minds.
So this is Mount Siesta...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Adele, be careful.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: This is as far as the transport will take us. We have to walk the rest of the way.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Monitoring Station No. 1 is halfway up the volcano. We still have a long walk ahead of us.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: I'm fine. My energy can keep up still.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: The scholar lowers her head. her heart is rending with a sharp, piercing pain.
Just who is the terrified one?
The volcano is right in front of her, but she cannot bring herself to take a single step forward.
Professor Keller. Are you okay?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Would you like to take my hand?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Streams colored dark red can be seen slowly climbing their way through the mountain rocks like the blood veins in one's body, all while the enormous thing breathes strenuously.
From the earth's core to this cliff, they flowed through the ages, enduring an intense heat and utter silence.
This path seems to not be nearly as long as Adele had imagined. With the strength she has, she can still climb onto this mountain.
But this path also seems to be much longer than she had imagined. It's long enough for her memories to be rinsed countless of times at the bottom of her heart.
This is where we set up the monitoring station.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: This equipment... Has someone been here?
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: But there are no other footprints on the mountain...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: The Originium energy response hasn't changed, but the temperature measurement instruments logged a high response...
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: She takes a look around and can make out only the dark mountain gravel and molten rocks in the shadows.
How strange...
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: The event has most likely ended. Let's tune the instruments and head back.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Kahn, what are you doing here?
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: (Out of breath)
attributes.name: Kahn

attributes.content: I heard... you two... climbed the volcano...
attributes.name: Kahn

attributes.content: Why...?
attributes.name: Kahn

attributes.content: Adele was worried because the monitoring station's indices were fluctuating, so we came here to inspect.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: It was probably caused by accident. We're preparing to evacuate to a safe observation point.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: The volcanic activity is definitely starting to pick up. The eruption might happen sooner than expected...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Yeah, we need to go.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Stay right there, Keller.
attributes.name: Kahn

attributes.content: Kahn?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: The man, still out of breath, is trembling. He pulls out a file from his chest, and the moment Keller sees its cover, her expression changes immediately.
September 1095, on Mount Unna, why did you suddenly leave the survey team...?
attributes.name: Kahn

attributes.content: And in November that year, you didn't attend the Naumanns' funeral, but someone said they saw you at a symposium with the military at William University.
attributes.name: Kahn

attributes.content: On top of that, not even Adele has seen Katia Naumann's research data. What is it doing in a letter between you and the Leithanian military?!
attributes.name: Kahn

attributes.content: Keller, answer me!
attributes.name: Kahn

attributes.content: Professor Keller...?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Adele, I told you that I'd share everything with you when this observation is done...
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Kahn, it's dangerous here. We should—
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Keller... Look where we're standing. The Naumanns were here, on this very volcano.
attributes.name: Kahn

attributes.content: Are you still going to lie, even here?!
attributes.name: Kahn

attributes.content: Hmm... I'm not really one to interfere with human affairs.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: But this isn't the place for a row...
attributes.name: Dolly
